questionText: At least half of U.S. Indians live in poverty.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Forty-nine percent of those living on Indian reservations are unemployed.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Federal funding is inadequate to satisfy the staggering needs of reservations.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Indian death rate is 35 times higher then the rest of the population
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: The reservation system has helped preserve Indian culture.
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: Federal funding in not enough to help the needs of the reservations.
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: The reservation system does recognize the Indian fishing and hunting rights.
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: The 1988 Indian Gaming Act allows reservations to hold bingo games and slot machine games.
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: The Indian population have a high incidence of alcoholism, diabetes, accidents and suicides.
author: A1G331HUXOSJAM

questionText: Many reservations are remote with little access to development.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Long rides to school means students can't stay to use school resources.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Tribal burocracies are scattered and ineffective.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Federal aid programs are inadequate.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Some reservations impose taxes on non-native Americans.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Many feel different rights based on bloodline is unconstitutional.
author: A1DUH3RLI00YQM

questionText: Indians comprise less than 1% of the population.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Indian reservations can set up casinos which bring job an money.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Only a few casinos are profitable.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Indian cigarette factories, not having to pay tax, can undersell non-reservation factories.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Half of Native American Indian on reservation live in poverty.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Native American Indians have unemployment that is 10 times the national average.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Violent crime is increasing.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: One-third of tribes offer gambling.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Reservations grant tribes self-rule.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: State taxes are not levied on Indians' reservation income.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Tribal authorities deal with minor crimes but turn to federal help for more serious crime.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Indians and the reservation system face decreased funding for Indian programs
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Native American Indian tribes can determine their own fishing and hunting rules.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Half of Native American Indians living on reservations live in poverty.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: A third of Native American Indian tribes offer gambling.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Banks are often unwilling to give Indians home loans that are backed by land held in trust.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: The federal government pays for clinics, schools, and welfare on reservations.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Casinos opened by Native American Indians are often opposed by localities that don't want local gambling.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: While tribal authorities deal with minor crimes, they turn to federal authorities for more drastic crimes.
author: A1CY01G7686ORZ

questionText: Indian tribes on reservations sovereignty allows them to run casinos.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Indians working on reservations pay no state income tax.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Unemployment often exceeds 50%.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: The death rate is 35 times higher than the rest of the population.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Crimes by non-Indians come under local authority.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Indian tribes on reservations enjoy a unique legal status.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Indian tribes' sovereignty allows them to run casinos.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Indians working on reservations pay federal income and social security taxes.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: At least half the Indian population lives in poverty.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Indians are over twice as often to be victims of violent crimes.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: Minor crimes by Indians come under tribal authority.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: The FBI or Bureau of Indian Affairs is responsible for serious crimes by Indians.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M
